summary: studies carried out on herpesviruses demonstrated that viral capsids contain significant amounts of polyamines that putatively neutralize charges on the viral DNA. chikungunya virus (CHIKV) and Zika virus (ZIKV), important pathogens responsible for serious outbreaks, rely on polyamines for both translation and transcription. cell counts and viability were measured on uninfected cells treated with DFMO for 5 days. cells were infected with Sindbis virus (SINV) at the indicated times (I) and treated with the indicated DFMO doses for 24 h. a recent perspective (13) highlights the importance of developing broad-spectrum antivirals. a nucleoside analog developed in 1972, is used successfully in the treatment of several viral diseases, including hemorrhagic fevers (14). ideally, these drugs would inhibit multiple viruses, possibly by targeting a host pathway that multiple viruses commandeer.
